result.execSummary:
The defendant Loren L. Lavin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Loren L. Lavin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Loren L. Lavin was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Supervision fees
Forfeiture of $5,000.00
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Assignment of bond will NOT be taken from this case as It is not Lauren's money and there is no consent from person who posted - $2000 for Atty cirilli will be taken from 15cm157 which is money posted from Defendantc
from Atty Cirilli
Consent to Assignment of Bond

02:33 pm - Defendant Loren L. Lavin in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15tr963, 15tr962, 15cm275(Initial), 15cm11, 15cm158, 15cm34,15cm81,15cm20,15cm102,15cm35 and 15cm157.  State moves to dismiss 15tr962 and 15tr963 - Granted.  In case 15cm11 Defendant pleads no contest. In case 15cm20  - State moves  to dismiss Count 1 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 2.  In case 15cm34 - State moves to amend Count 1 to ordinance DC and dismiss count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1.  In case 15cm35 - Defendant pleads no contest.  In case 15cm81 - State moves to dismiss - Granted.  In case 15cm102 - State moves to dismiss - Granted.  In case 15cm157 - State moves to dismiss - Granted.  In case 15cm158 - State moves to dismiss counts 1 through 6 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 7.  In case 15cm275 - Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Mitch Laven/Sara Burghaus/Amy Laven/Schiek/Cirilli/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence

Defendant Loren L Lavin in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the Oneida County.  Also calling 15CM20, 15CM34, 15CM35, 15CM81, 15CM157 15CM158, 15CM102, 15CM11 15TR507, 15TR962 and 15TR963.  Court notes - No Initial  appearances on  15CM157 and 15CM158 - Atty Cirilli statement would like to do initial appearance on those two and defendant to plead to 15TR506 - defendant pleads No Contest to - court questions defendant - court finds defendant guilty.  Atty Schiek statement to  -$762, 6 months revocation.  and asks court to find 15TR507 reasonable.  Court grants motion to find refusal reasonable.  Atty Cirilli pleads Not Guilty on 15CM157 and 15CM158 and asks court to set over to PTC.  Bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

No resolution. - Cirilli states has not rec'd all of the discovery.  Requests adjournment.  Court admonishes defendant as to the no contact provision of bond.  Bail continued. 02:42 pm - Defendant Loren L. Lavin in court, via video,  with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Loren L. Lavin in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm35, 15cm34, 15cm11 and 15cm20.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Cirilli motion to modify bond 
to a $2,000 cash bond with same conditions which was set in 15cm35 and 15cm34.  Schiek statement to motion.  Court amends to $2500 cash bond - same conditions.
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant states has counsel - has not informed yet of new charges.  Bednar/Defendant statement to bail - Court continues the $10,00.00 cash bond posted.
